author: tbenr
content:
To me, everything becomes clearer if, in the signing section, we exhaustively list which domain applies to which objects:
```
In-protocol messages: `BlindedBeaconBlock`. Should compute the signing root using compute_signing_root and use the domain specified for beacon block proposals (we could link consensus spec here).
Builder API messages: `ValidatorRegistrationV1`, `BuilderBid`. Should compute the signing root using compute_signing_root with domain given by compute_domain(DOMAIN_APPLICATION_BUILDER). As compute_signing_root takes SSZObject as input, client software should convert in-protocol messages to their SSZ representation to compute the signing root and Builder API messages to the SSZ representations defined above.
```
